info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:29AM CST until January 12 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CST FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LIMESTONE...NORTHWESTERN MORGAN AND EAST CENTRAL LAWRENCE COUNTIES... At 829 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Trinity, or near Decatur, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency Management and weather spotters reported a funnel cloud northeast of Moulton. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Limestone, northwestern Morgan and east central Lawrence Counties, including the following locations... Caddo and Hillsboro. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
